recommendations: Fish Roll and Flop is a movement where the dancer rolls their body in a fluid motion resembling the movement of a fish, while the Flop is a contemporary dance move where the dancer falls to the ground in a sudden and dramatic manner.. For practicing Fish Roll and Flop as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Cross-body shoulder stretch: Sit or stand with your feet hip-width apart. Reach one arm across your body, using your other arm to gently pull it towards your chest. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Thread the needle stretch: Begin on your hands and knees, then thread one arm through the space between your opposite arm and knee. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then switch sides., Reverse table-top pose: Sit on the ground with your hands behind you and your feet on the ground. Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, creating a table-top shape with your body. Hold for 10-20 seconds, then release. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart and engage your core muscles for stability., Lift right shoulder up and back., Simultaneously lift left shoulder up and forward., Move right shoulder down and forward., Move left shoulder down and back, alternating continuously. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.

Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an intermediate performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Box jumps, Skater jumps, Plyometric lunges for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Begin in B-plus position., Swing arms forward, then up into crossed position., Jump off back foot, bringing legs into crossed position., Rotate 360 degrees, maintaining crossed leg position., Land on the back foot, bending knees to absorb impact. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.

Axel Turn is a jump in which the skater rotates 360 degrees in the air, landing on the back foot.. For practicing Axel Turn as a/an amateur performance, the recommended warm-up exercises are Jumping jacks, Single-leg hops, Tuck jumps for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. After warming up, you should practice the following instructions: Start in B-plus position., Swing arms forward and jump off back foot., Rotate 360 degrees with legs crossed., Land on the back foot., Practice with a half turn first. for 5 repetitions for 10 minutes. Since you want to particularly focus on coordination, additional exercises could include Pirouette with arms, Spotting practice, Quick footwork patterns.
